title: How should I prepare for the UPSC? Should I finish all the NCERTs at one go or should I prepare subject-wise along with the standard books? - Quora
tags: National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)
Union Public Service Commission of India

response.answer_text: Selective reading of ncert is the key Ncert' s are the base of upsc exam … it will take you to the preparation 1 st stage when you recollect all the basics needed for exam that will surely help you in the future . Ncerts are aslo engaging with wide variety of examples and precise content .. not too lengthy is also another important advantage . By heart basic cocnepts like for geography Equinox Longitudes Physical geo Winds Isotherms Effect of altitude on temp Atmosphere Continental drift All these will help you to understand all the concepts needed further in this exam

Given the general substance of the syllabus, there could be hundreds, if not thousands, of books that could be potentially claimed as preparatory material. It is best to follow some of the known study materials and brush up on your high school texts, and follow daily current affairs in India and the world in daily newspapers. It is essential to keep a regular reading, and writing habit. It develops a focused effort towards training your brain to understand and analyze information.
